metadata.title: Genome sequence variation analysis of two SARS coronavirus isolates after passage in Vero cell culture

abstract.original_text: SARS coronavirus is an RNA virus whose replication is error-prone, which provides possibility for escape of host defenses, and even leads to evolution of new viral strains during the passage or the transmission. Lots of variations have been detected among different SARS-CoV strains. And a study on these variations is helpful for development of efficient vaccine. Moreover, the test of nucleic acid characterization and genetic stability of SARS-CoV is important in the research of inactivated vaccine. The whole genome sequences of two SARS coronavirus strains after passage in Vero cell culture were determined and were compared with those of early passages, respectively. Results showed that both SARS coronavirus strains have high genetic stability, although nearly 10 generations were passed. Four nucleotide variations were observed between the second passage and the 11th passage of Sino1 strain for identification of SARS inactivated vaccine. Moreover, only one nucleotide was different between the third passage and the 10th passage of Sin03 strain for SARS inactivated vaccine. Therefore, this study suggested it was possible to develop inactivated vaccine against SARS-CoV in the future.

sentences.segment_text: SARS coronavirus is an RNA virus whose replication is error-prone ,
which provides possibility for escape of host defenses ,
and even leads to evolution of new viral strains during the passage or the transmission .
Lots of variations have been detected among different SARS-CoV strains .
And a study on these variations is helpful for development of efficient vaccine .
Moreover , the test of nucleic acid characterization and genetic stability of SARS-CoV is important in the research of inactivated vaccine .
The whole genome sequences of two SARS coronavirus strains after passage in Vero cell culture were determined and were compared with those of early passages , respectively .
Results showed that both SARS coronavirus strains have high genetic stability ,
Four nucleotide variations were observed between the second passage and the 11th passage of Sino1 strain for identification of SARS inactivated vaccine .
Moreover , only one nucleotide was different between the third passage and the 10th passage of Sin03 strain for SARS inactivated vaccine .
Therefore , this study suggested it was possible to develop inactivated vaccine against SARS-CoV in the future .
